verses.verse: "Man,<WH120> who is born<WH3205> of woman,<WH802> Is short-lived and full<WH7649> of turmoil.<WH7267>
"Like a flower<WH6731> he comes<WH3318> forth<WH3318> and withers.<WH9268> He also flees<WH1272> like a shadow<WH6738> and does not remain.<WH5975>
"Thou also<WH637> dost open<WH6491> Thine eyes<WH5869> on him, And bring<WH935> him into judgment<WH4941> with Thyself.
"Who<WH4310> can make<WH5414> the clean<WH2889> out of the unclean<WH2931>? No<WH3808> one!<WH259>
"Since<WH518> his days<WH3117> are determined,<WH2782> The number<WH4557> of his months<WH2320> is with Thee, And his limits<WH2706> Thou hast set<WH6213> so that he cannot<WH3808> pass.<WH5674>
"Turn<WH8159> Thy gaze<WH8159> from him that he may rest,<WH2308> Until<WH5704> he fulfills<WH7521> his day<WH3117> like a hired<WH7916> man.<WH7916>
"For there<WH3426> is hope<WH8615> for a tree,<WH6086> When<WH518> it is cut<WH3772> down,<WH3772> that it will sprout<WH2498> again,<WH5750> And its shoots<WH3127> will not fail.<WH2308>
"Though<WH518> its roots<WH8328> grow<WH2204> old<WH2204> in the ground,<WH776> And its stump<WH1503> dies<WH4191> in the dry<WH6083> soil,<WH6083>
At the scent<WH7381> of water<WH4325> it will flourish<WH6524> And put<WH6213> forth<WH6213> sprigs<WH9524> like<WH3644> a plant.<WH5194>
"But man<WH1397> dies<WH4191> and lies<WH2522> prostrate.<WH2522> Man<WH120> expires,<WH1478> and where<WH335> is he?
"[As] water<WH4325> evaporates<WH235> from the sea,<WH3220> And a river<WH5104> becomes<WH9162> parched<WH9162> and dried<WH3001> up,

So man<WH376> lies<WH7901> down<WH7901> and does not rise.<WH6965> Until<WH5704> the heavens<WH8064> be no<WH1115> more,<WH1115> He will not awake<WH9516> nor<WH3808> be aroused<WH5782> out of his sleep.<WH8142>

"Oh<WH4310> <WH5414> that Thou wouldst hide<WH6845> me in Sheol,<WH7585> That Thou wouldst conceal<WH5641> me until<WH5704> Thy wrath<WH639> returns<WH7725> [to Thee,] That Thou wouldst set<WH7896> a limit<WH2706> for me and remember<WH2142> me!
"If<WH518> a man<WH1397> dies,<WH4191> will he live<WH2421> [again?] All<WH3605> the days<WH3117> of my struggle<WH6635> I will wait,<WH3176> Until<WH5704> my change<WH2487> comes.<WH935>
"Thou wilt call,<WH7121> and I will answer<WH6030> Thee; Thou wilt long<WH3700> for the work<WH4639> of Thy hands.<WH3027>
"For now<WH6258> Thou dost number<WH5608> my steps,<WH6806> Thou dost not observe<WH8104> my sin.<WH9128>
"My transgression<WH6588> is sealed<WH2856> up in a bag,<WH6872> And Thou dost wrap<WH2950> up my iniquity.<WH5771>
"But the falling<WH5307> mountain<WH2022> crumbles<WH5034> away,<WH5034> And the rock<WH6697> moves<WH6275> from its place;<WH4725>
Water<WH4325> wears<WH7833> away<WH7833> stones,<WH68> Its torrents<WH9372> wash<WH7857> away<WH7857> the dust<WH6083> of the earth;<WH776> So Thou dost destroy man's hope.<WH6>
"Thou dost forever<WH5331> overpower<WH8630> him and he departs;<WH1980> [Thou] dost change<WH8132> his appearance<WH6440> and send<WH7971> him away.<WH7971>
"His sons<WH1121> achieve<WH3513> honor,<WH3513> but he does not know<WH3045> [it;] Or they become<WH6819> insignificant,<WH6819> but he does not perceive<WH995> it.
"But his body<WH1320> pains<WH3510> him, And he mourns<WH56> only for himself.<WH5315>"
